page_content:
Setting up Child Objects

Version:MissionOS_2.0

You can create composite instruments using any kind of instrumentation with the following two conditionalities:

  • Parent and child composite instruments must belong to the same type of instrumentation
  • Parent and child composite instruments are of different subtypes (optional condition but recommended)

Firstly, create the Object Type. For more information, see Type - Object Type Creation

 

 

Now, perform the steps in Model interface to add an Object Subtype. For more information, see Model - Add Object Subtype

To create a Composite Instrument, you must create both Child Subtypes and Master or Parent Subtype.

 

 

Initially create the child subtype of the instrument.

Here, define the calculations necessary to obtain the processed data for each sensor.

The model is defined following the same procedure as for any other instrument.

Define the fields in the order as given below:

  1. Firstly, define the data fields.
  2. Secondly, the necessary calibrations.
  3. Finally, any calculations required.

For more details on adding data, calibration and calculation fields, see the following chapters:

Model - Add Data Fields

Model - Add Calibration Fields

Model - Add Calculation Fields

 

You can edit or delete any fields, if required.

 

 

Note on Object Permissions:

 

In Manage Setup File, you can set Object permissions for composite child instrument.

For example, out of three child composite instruments you can hide one child from a user group using permissions.

 

Note on Relationship Order:

 

This feature is to set the processing order ascending or descending for master instrument as you set up a composite instrument.

 

In the composite instrument Model page,

  1. Click the Manage Setup File.
  2. Select relationship_order.
  3. Click Save Configuration.

 

 

 

Next step in the process is to download the setup file for composite instrument.

In the template downloaded, specify the sort order (as ASC for ascending and DESC for descending) at master instrument.

Figure 5 shows how the tabulation is done in the downloaded template.

 

 

 

Loaded data is processed in the sort order specified in the master instrument relationship order. Thus, the child instrument data get processed.
